title: Superman Comic Found in Attic Sells for Millions
summary: Three brothers found a very old Superman comic book in their mom's attic in California. It was from 1939 and was in great condition. They sold it at an auction for $9.12 million, which is the most money ever paid for a comic book. The comic is called Superman #1 and was kept safe because the weather in California is good for preserving paper. Their mom had bought it a long time ago and told them it was valuable, but they didn't see it until after she passed away. This story is exciting because it shows how something old can become very valuable and make people's lives better.

background_read: Comic books are fun stories with pictures, and Superman is a famous superhero who first appeared in 1938. Auctions are events where people sell things to the highest bidder. Sometimes, old items like comics can become very valuable if they are rare and in good condition. This story shows how a family found a treasure that made them rich.
Article_Structure: WHO: Three brothers and their late mother
WHAT: Found and sold a valuable Superman comic book for $9.12 million
WHERE: In a loft in California, sold by Heritage Auctions in Texas
WHY: Because the comic was rare, in good condition, and set a new record for comic book sales

perspectives.description: The brothers were happy to find something valuable that their mom had kept, changing their lives.
The comic is important because it is very old and shows the start of Superman stories.
